alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 15 at 11:04AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, the McBride Burn Scar in the South Central Mountains. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous thunderstorms are forecast today. Storm motion will be slow and erratic with the strongest cells capable of producing rain at rates near 1 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
